item.description:
We will be hiking to Square Ledge via the Oliverian Brook Trail.

Hikers must have winter gear and some type of foot traction (Micro-spikes, Crampons, etc........)

We will be starting promptly at 9:00, so please arrive by 8:45.

All attendees must read, understand and agree to the liability waiver and the code of responsible hikers found on this web site.

entering wilderness area
1.90 mi 1 hr 6 min +240 ft on Oliverian Brook Trail
1.90 mi 1 hr 6 min +240 ft This trail runs from the Kancamagus Highway to the Lawrence
and Kelley trails at Paugus Pass. Parts of the trail, particularly
south of the Passaconaway Cutoff, are wet, though recent
relocations have improved the situation. Grades are mostly easy.
The part of the trail south of the Passaconaway Cutoff is in the
Sandwich Range Wilderness.
The trail follows the gravel road beyond the gate for 125 yd., turns
sharp left (sign) on a cross-country ski trail that it follows for
another 125 yd., then turns sharp right on the old route of the trail.
It crosses an old railroad bed and a recent logging road, then
bears right onto an old railroad grade along the west side of
Oliverian Brook (in the reverse direction, bear left here) and
follows it, passing a beaver pond that sometimes floods the trail.
Then it turns left off the railroad grade, and at the Passaconaway
Cutoff diverges right (southwest).
to the junction of Passaconaway Cutoff 43° 58' 14" 71° 20' 58"
1.70 mi 1 hr 24 min +1053 ft on Passaconaway Cutoff
3.60 mi 2 hr 30 min +1292 ft This trail provides the shortest route to Mt. Passaconaway from
the north, running from the Oliverian Brook Trail, to the Square
Ledge Trail (and thence to the summit via the Walden Trail). The
entire trail is in the Sandwich Range Wilderness.
Leaving the Oliverian Brook Trail, the cutoff follows an old logging
road at easy grades, crosses a brook, then runs above the brook.
Then it turns left and climbs steadily, with glimpses of Mt.
Passaconaway across the valley. It climbs over a ledge with a
view north to Hedgehog Mountain and continues up to the
junction with the Square Ledge Trail west of Square Ledge.
to the junction of Square Ledge Trail 43° 57' 07" 71° 22' 02"
0.60 mi 33 min -170 ft on Square Ledge Trail
4.20 mi 3 hr 3 min +1122 ft This trail begins at the junction of the Old Mast Rd. and the
Walden and Lawrence trails, climbs over Square Ledge, and
ascends to the Walden Trail just below the summit cone of Mt.
Passaconaway. It is entirely within the Sandwich Range
Wilderness. In some recent years, peregrine falcons have nested
on the cliff of Square Ledge, so access to the principal Square
Ledge viewpoint may be restricted during the nesting season
(April 1 to August 1).
The trail ascends to the junction with the Passaconaway Cutoff on
the left. It descends steeply down a shoulder then ascends
alongside a rock face. A side
path climbs right up a steep ledge with a view of Mt.
Passaconaway (use caution—the edge of the cliff is partly
obscured by scrubby growth). The main trail ascends to the
wooded summit of the knob.
to Square Ledge 43° 57' 12" 71° 21' 38"
0.60 mi 33 min +170 ft on Square Ledge Trail
4.80 mi 3 hr 36 min +1292 ft Leaving the ledge, the trail ascends to the wooded summit of the
knob above the ledge. Just past this summit an unmarked side
path climbs left up a steep ledge with a view of Mt. Passaconaway
(use caution—the edge of the cliff is partly obscured by scrubby
growth). The main trail descends alongside a rock face, then
climbs steeply up a shoulder, turns sharp right, and descends to
the junction with the Passaconaway Cutoff on the right.
to the junction of Passaconaway Cutoff 43° 57' 07" 71° 22' 02"
1.70 mi 1 hr 24 min -1053 ft on Passaconaway Cutoff
6.50 mi 5 hr 0 min +240 ft The cutoff leaves the junction with the Square Ledge Trail west of
Square Ledge. It descends to a ledge with a view north to
Hedgehog Mountain, then descends steadily with glimpses of Mt.
Passaconaway across the valley. It runs above a brook then
crosses it then follows an old logging road at easy grades to the
Oliverian Brook Trail.
